data.name: Stiletto
data.description: Provocative statement of slick and sexy, blend of bold black currant with lighter tones of honey and apple sweetness.
data.foodPairings: Pairs with rich, spicy Mediterranean cuisine, turkey, stews, steaks, curry and Italian meat sauce. Compliments cheddar, blue cheese, or camembert.

style.name: Sweet Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a well-made dessert wine (such as Sauternes), with a pleasant mixture of honey character, residual sweetness, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Moonlight Meadery
breweries.description:
It all started back in 1995, when Michael tried a cyser (apple and honey mead) for the first time.  Since that first sip Michael has developed a passion, and a masterful skill at making international award winning meads. Michael Fairbrother has started Moonlight Meadery™, with a mission to bring ultra premium meads to the market place.  It is more than a product and it is more than a process, it's our obsession.

"Mead to me is passion, it's about living and love, it's about enjoyment, family and friends, and sharing." says Michael Fairbrother, Founder and Mead Maker. 

Our meads will be unique, and unlike anything you have ever tried, you will find it incredible!   We are going to embrace the unique nature of natural honey as minimally processed as possible.

data.name: StrawBeRi Rose BzZz
data.description: Either "drinking-in" the Summer Garden or drinking in the Summer Garden; enjoying the taste of fresh Strawberries, Honey and Rose Hip Tea is the next best thing to being in a Summer Garden.
data.foodPairings: Pair with light meals, salads or fresh fruit.

breweries.name: B. Nektar Meadery
breweries.description:
Known for the most amazing and creative alcoholic beverages made from honey. B. Nektar is a world-wide sensation.

To boldly go where no meadery has gone before. To prove to you that the horrible mead your best friend made one time in college is NOT what a good mead should taste like. To show you that mead doesn't HAVE to be sweet. To educate you on the different styles of mead. To bring mead into the mainstream, but still maintain our integrity. To everyday thank my mom and tell her that I love her (shouldn't we all?).

data.name: Sumptuous
data.description: Made from honey and mangos, sweet but not overly so, smooth, wonderful complexity between the flavors and the long lasting finish, with a light body.
data.foodPairings: Enjoy with spiced Mexican, Asian, and Indian dishes.

data.name: Sweet Peach Mead
data.description: Sweet Peach Mead reminds us of ripe, juicy summer peaches, bursting with flavor. Serve this sweet wine chilled at a picnic or use it to brighten up your favorite pork or spicy chicken dish. Great mead for summer porch sippin'!

style.name: Sweet Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a well-made dessert wine (such as Sauternes), with a pleasant mixture of honey character, residual sweetness, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Starrlight Mead
breweries.description:
After several years as home mead makers, we are thrilled to be opening Starrlight Mead. We have had a fantastic time making mead and meeting mead drinkers from all over the world, and now its our turn to share our love of mead with all of you!

Becky Starr, Owner, Sales/Tasting Room Manager
Ben Starr, Owner, Wine/Meadmaker

We first discovered mead in CA at the Southern California Renaissance Pleasure Faire. Several years later, we found friends that were home brewing mead with good results. We decided to try our hand at it too.

In February 2006, we entered our first competition and took Best in Show out of over 210 entries in the home mead-maker category at the International Mead Association’s Mead Festival. The competition was judged by seven professionals in the mead industry; including Ken Schramm, author of The Compleat Mead Maker, and meadery owners from around the world. The Best in Show prize was selected from the gold medal winners in nine categories. Our “Starrlight Mulled Apple Cyser” was awarded not only the gold medal in the cyser (mead made with apples) category, but was also selected as the best overall representation of mead making. It was at that point we decided to try creating a business from our love of mead.

Ben shares his expertise and love of brewing by conducting demonstrations and workshops on mead making in the local community. We also organize and conduct the local Mead Day celebration each August (since 2005) and are a key part of the product tasting team for mead reviews on Gotmead.com. Becky worked with Chatham Hill Winery for 2 years learning tasting room and wine club management. We are members of the Chatham County Beekeepers Association, and the NC Winegrowers Association.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Regular Hours
Thursdays and Fridays from noon til 6 pm

Saturdays from noon til 6 pm
Meadery tours at 1 pm, 3 pm & 5 pm.

Sundays from 1 pm til 5 pm
Meadery tours at 2 pm & 4 pm.

data.name: Traditional Semi-Sweet Mead
data.description: A sweeter honey wine. Fabulous floral honey nose (from the wild flower honey) and long lingering honey finish! Just what you would expect from mead! Wonderful with spicy foods or NY style cheesecake!
data.foodPairings: Wonderful with spicy foods or NY style cheesecake

data.name: Tropical BzZz
data.description: Like the music of the Islands, Jammin BzZz has splashes of sunny tropical fruits that will melt away the cold winter chill.
data.foodPairings: It drinks like a song that harmonizes with seafood, salads and your imagination.

data.name: Tuco Style Freakout
data.description:
Tuco-Style Freakout, also known as our Agave Lime, is set to hit shelves April 2016 and brings such a good flavor that this stuff would give Heisenberg a run for his money.


We introduced this agave lime mead to the 2015 Michigan Mead Cup and was awarded Best In Show and a Gold Medal.  The inspiration comes from a Margarita mead that our mead makers wanted to have as a lighter carbonated version and something that was an easy drinking, warm weather crusher.  With the Mexican/southwest ingredients inspired by the Margarita mead, it seemed appropriate to create a label based on everyone’s favorite southwest-set show, Breaking Bad.  Tuco was an unforgettable character, and while he made have been erratic, this mead is nothing but tight, tight, tight!  Take a look here are more info on the Tuco-Style Freakout!

breweries.name: Perrin Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located 10 minutes north of downtown Grand Rapids, Michigan, our micro brewery and taproom is striving to bring a world class experience to every person who walks through our doors.

With a hospitality philosophy of treating our customers like they're guests in our home, we look forward to serving you.

data.name: Virtue
data.description: Conditioned in our Utopian barrels for up to 6 months.  Hints of vanilla and coconut from the oak, blend with the apple and honey.  A deep rich apple with the hints of bourbon and a smooth honey finish.  Clearly something of special worth.

data.name: Wicked
data.description:
Wicked as in awesome, the ginger and Madagascar-Bourbon vanilla each add a nuance to the honey flavor and aroma.  Spice from the ginger balances well with the smoothness of the vanilla.  It lures you in for more, wicked things may be in store.

Gold Medal winner at the 2014 Mazer Cup International

data.name: “Conquered” Grape BzZz
data.description: WoW! That’s all that needs to be said about this beverage historically referred to as a “Pyment”. Concord grapes sometimes get a bad rap from fine wine makers as grapes that produce inferior wines; Acoustic has “conquered” this dilemma. Natural honey, cherry, herbs and spices present just the right backdrop for Conquered Grape BzZz to put on a very tastefully complex show that pairs with just about anything. WoW!
